ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Great opportunities to catch up with the scientific trend in the biostatistics field.

I think in theory it was a good idea to have students enroll in this course and keep up with current biostatistics work. However, as a first year student, I felt overwhelmed by the talks, not having studied any of the topics yet. There was no point at which we got an introduction to the material being discussed in the lecture series, so every week just felt like a gigantic waste of time with no benefit.
Sometimes the lectures are a little hard to understand, but most are interesting.
It includes broad research topics in biostatistics, which is helpful for students to find their interests.
A good way to learn about various things going on within the field. A good and necessary class.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Different speakers come in to talk about their research in biostatistics. It might be interesting if there was some background information given to us prior to the talks, but because there was none, I would not recommend signing up unless it's a requirement.
Good way to keep up to date on innovations and current research in the field of biostatistics.
Great seminar as extension to basic courses.
